alert.note: Alert for North Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued August 07 at 8:10PM MDT until August 08 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR THE NORTHWEST PLATEAU AND NORTH CENTRAL MOUNTAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITIES AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .A very unusual period of marginal to possibly critical fire weather is expected to continue on Tuesday as dry westerly flow impacts northern New Mexico. Hot, dry, windy, and unstable conditions will be possible Tuesday afternoon and evening over the Northwest Plateau and North Central Mountains where a Fire Weather Watch remains in effect. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING HAS EXPIRED... * AREA AND TIMING...North Central Mountains (Zone 120) from Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...7 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
